Certainly! There are several free and paid resources available for creating flashcards and quizzes. Here are a few options:

1. Quizlet: This is a popular flashcard and study app that allows you to create digital flashcards and quizzes on a variety of subjects.

2. Anki: This is another flashcard app that uses spaced repetition to help you learn and retain information more effectively.

3. StudyBlue: This is a study platform that offers numerous study tools, including flashcards and quizzes.

4. Google Forms: You can easily create your own quizzes or surveys using Google Forms. It's free and easy-to-use!

As for ensuring that you truly understand the material and not just memorizing it, here are a few tips:

1. Test yourself: Instead of just reading and re-reading the material, try to actively test yourself on it. Create flashcards or quizzes, and force yourself to recall information from memory.

2. Use examples: Try to relate the complex theory or concept to real-world examples or scenarios. This can help you better understand the material and prevent you from just memorizing it.

3. Teach someone else: As I mentioned earlier, one of the best ways to reinforce your understanding of complex material is to teach it to someone else. This can help you identify areas where you may be struggling and force you to explain the material in simple, understandable terms.

4. Apply the material: Try to apply the complex theory or concept in practice. This can help reinforce your understanding of the material and help you identify any gaps in your knowledge.
